subclusters.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic regulation of longevity via insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR nutrient-sensing pathways controlling metabolism and growth.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes IGF1-TXNIP axis mediating cellular senescence linked to IGF1 signaling, part of insulin/IGF-1 pathway effects on aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details IGF-I signaling modulation as a key regulator of aging and longevity, fitting insulin/IGF-1 pathway mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on IGF-1/PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway in aging regulation and pharmacological modulation, part of insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes IGF signaling pathway as conserved regulator of lifespan, involving IGF1R and downstream effectors in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers conserved genetic pathways including insulin/IGF-1 and TOR signaling pathways regulating longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: GH deficiency and longevity theory links reduced GH/IGF1 signaling to lifespan extension, fitting insulin/IGF-1 pathway theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General programmed aging theory highlighting genetic regulation including insulin/IGF pathway and endocrine involvement.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Sirtuin-Mediated Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on dSir2 (a sirtuin) regulating lifespan in a diet-dependent manner, linking sirtuins to programmed longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Sirtuin-Mediated Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes sirtuins as NAD+-dependent enzymes mediating caloric restriction benefits and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Sirtuin-Mediated Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: TORC1 inhibition enhances Sir2 association with rDNA to promote lifespan extension, linking sirtuins and nutrient signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Dependent Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening limiting cell replication and causing programmed decline in cell turnover.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Growth-Limiting Genetic Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes juvenile growth deceleration genetic program persisting into adulthood, limiting proliferation and driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Programmatic Aging Trajectory Genetic Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes aging as a programmed genetic trajectory in gene expression space with attractor states.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Aging as programmed adaptation to enhance population turnover and evolvability via multilevel selection.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Views aging as an optional genetic program enhancing offspring evolvability and population adaptation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models aging as phenoptosis that saves populations from extinction by resource reallocation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Phenoptosis theory describing programmed death as evolutionary adaptation with altruistic population benefits.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmed and altruistic aging in yeast promoting group survival and population adaptation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmed lifespan in colonial protochordate with genetic control of synchronized mortality supporting population-level aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetically programmed aging in Botryllus schlosseri with heritable lifespan and nonrandom senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolvability and Population-Level Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Aging as an executable program beneficial for species evolvability and modulated by environmental signals.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Mediated Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Programmed aging driven by mitochondrial ROS generation triggering apoptosis and organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Mediated Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Phenoptosis theory emphasizing mitochondria and ROS in programmed organismal death at multiple biological levels.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR Signaling Programmed Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Nutrient sensing pathways including TOR and JNK regulate aging, fitting with insulin/IGF-1 and mTOR signaling mechanisms.
